==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|かん|しん|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かんしん}} compound {{m|zh|汗疹|tr=han<sup>H</sup> trhin<sup>H</sup>|lit=sweat + rash}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|汗疹|tr=hànzhěn|miliaria}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|かんしん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かんしん}}

# [[miliaria]]: [[prickly heat]], [[heat rash]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=あせも}}
Compound of {{l|ja|汗|tr=''ase'', "sweat"}} + uncertain element {{lang|ja|も}} or {{lang|ja|ぼ}}. According to one theory, this may be an alteration of {{l|ja|疣|tr=''ibo'', ''imo'', "wart, verruca"}}. This same ''ibo'' / ''imo'' element appears in the reading for {{l|ja|疱瘡|tr=''imogasa''}}, an archaic word for a [[pockmark]] or a [[pox]] and sometimes shortened to just ''imo''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|あせも|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あせも}}

# [[miliaria]]: [[prickly heat]], [[heat rash]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=あせぼ}}
Compound of {{l|ja|汗|tr=''ase'', "sweat"}} + uncertain element {{lang|ja|も}} or {{lang|ja|ぼ}}. According to one theory, this may be an alteration of {{l|ja|疣|tr=''ibo'', ''imo'', "wart, verruca"}}. This same ''ibo'' / ''imo'' element appears in the reading for {{l|ja|疱瘡|tr=''imogasa''}}, an archaic word for a [[pockmark]] or a [[pox]] and sometimes shortened to just ''imo''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|あせぼ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あせぼ}}

# {{lb|ja|rare|sort=あせぼ}} [[miliaria]]: [[prickly heat]], [[heat rash]]
